title: WSO2 Agent Evaluation Dataset Schema
description: Schema for defining evaluation datasets for AI agents. Supports both simple Q&A tasks and complex multi-step agent evaluations with trajectories, outcomes, and constraints.

name.description: Human-readable name of the dataset. Used for identification and reporting.

description.description: Detailed description of the dataset's purpose, scope, and evaluation goals.

version.description: Semantic version of the dataset (e.g., '1.0.0'). Used to track dataset iterations and changes.

schema_version.description: Version of this schema specification. Currently '1.0'. Allows for schema evolution.

metadata.description: Dataset-level metadata for authorship, classification, and discovery.

created_by.description: Author or team that created the dataset.

created_at.description: ISO 8601 timestamp when the dataset was created.

domain.description: Domain or industry vertical this dataset targets (e.g., 'customer-service', 'healthcare', 'legal').

tags.description: Searchable tags for categorizing and filtering datasets.

description.description: Additional descriptive metadata (distinct from root-level description).

defaults.description: Default constraints and settings applied to all tasks unless overridden at task level. Useful for setting dataset-wide performance expectations.

max_latency_ms.description: Default maximum acceptable latency in milliseconds. Tasks exceeding this may fail latency evaluators.

max_tokens.description: Default maximum token budget (input + output). Prevents excessive LLM usage.

max_iterations.description: Default maximum agent iterations/steps. Prevents infinite loops.

prohibited_content.description: Default list of strings/patterns that should NOT appear in agent outputs. Useful for safety/compliance.

tasks.description: List of evaluation tasks/test cases. Each task represents one unit of evaluation.

id.description: Unique identifier for the task within this dataset. Used for tracking and reporting.

name.description: Short human-readable name for the task. Displayed in UIs and reports.

description.description: Detailed description of what the task tests. Helps evaluators understand context.
examples: User wants to book a flight from NYC to LA on March 15

input.description: The user query/prompt that triggers the agent. This is what the agent receives as input.
examples: Book me a flight from NYC to LA on March 15

reference_output.description: OPTIONAL: Expected final output/response from the agent. Used by output comparison evaluators. Also called 'expected_output' or 'ground_truth'.
examples: I've booked your flight from NYC to LA on March 15. Confirmation #ABC123.

reference_trajectory.description: OPTIONAL: Expected sequence of tool calls the agent should make. Used to evaluate whether agent follows correct execution path.

tool.description: Name of the tool/function that should be called.

args.description: Expected arguments passed to the tool. Can be exact match or pattern.

expected_output.description: OPTIONAL: Expected output from this specific tool call.

expected_outcome.description: OPTIONAL: Expected side effects or state changes in the external environment (not just LLM output). Verifies that the agent actually accomplished the task. Examples: database record created, API called, file written. This is a free-form object - structure depends on your outcome validators.

success_criteria.description: OPTIONAL: Human-readable description of what constitutes success. Used by LLM-as-judge evaluators to guide their assessment. Should be clear, specific, and actionable.
examples: Agent should search for available flights and complete the booking. User should receive a confirmation number.
Output should be a single number with no explanation.
Agent must use the calculator tool and show step-by-step reasoning.

prohibited_content.description: OPTIONAL: Task-specific list of strings/patterns that should NOT appear in the output. Overrides dataset defaults. Useful for safety, compliance, or negative testing.

constraints.description: OPTIONAL: Task-specific performance constraints. Override dataset defaults for this task only.

max_latency_ms.description: Maximum acceptable latency for this task in milliseconds.

max_tokens.description: Maximum token budget for this task.

max_iterations.description: Maximum agent iterations for this task.

task_type.description: OPTIONAL: Type/category of the task. Used for grouping and specialized evaluators.

difficulty.description: OPTIONAL: Subjective difficulty rating. Used for analysis and stratified evaluation.

domain.description: OPTIONAL: Task-specific domain (can differ from dataset domain).

tags.description: OPTIONAL: Task-specific tags for filtering and analysis.

custom.description: OPTIONAL: Arbitrary task-specific metadata. Passed through to evaluators via EvalContext. Use for custom evaluator logic, priority, categories, etc. Can be any structure.

metadata.description: OPTIONAL: Task-level metadata for tracking, authorship, and review workflow. NOT passed to evaluators (unlike 'custom'). Used for dataset management.

last_updated.description: When this task was last modified.

tasks.name: Flight Booking
tasks.description: User wants to book a flight
tasks.input: Book me a flight from NYC to LA on March 15
tasks.reference_output: I've booked your flight from NYC to LA on March 15. Confirmation #ABC123.
tasks.success_criteria: Agent should search for available flights and complete the booking. User should receive a confirmation number.
